p: (1) Effect of Subacute Treatment of Rats with HS Extract on AST, ALT, and ALP. The results of the clinical biochemistry parameters assessed in this work, aspartate aminotransferase (AST), alanine aminotransferase (ALT), and alkaline phosphatase (ALP), are summarised in Figure 2. It can be seen that there was a significant increase in ALP observed in groups treated with doses of 1000 mg/kg and 2000 mg/kg compared to the control group ( P < 0.05; P < 0.01). However, the daily oral administration of HS extract to the rats of all groups provoked a significant decrease in the plasma levels of ALT ( P < 0.01) and AST ( P < 0.001) compared with the rats of the control group.
